articles.description:
Jan  9, 15:10 PST
Resolved - From 14:00-15:00 Pacific Time (PT), we saw increased 500 errors for multiple API endpoints, including reservations, listings and threads. The issue is now identified and resolved, please retry any failed requests during this time. Apologies for the inconvenience caused due to this incident and thank you for your patience and understanding.
articles.title: 500 Errors Across Multiple Endpoints

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-12-13 15:34 and ended at 2022-12-13 18:04 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

A combined Incident Report has been published on our Google Workspace Status Dashboard for this Incident - https://www.google.com/appsstatus/dashboard/incidents/AzeVS1iCHxhtzgi8r3mc

Affected products: Gmail
articles.title:
RESOLVED: We are experiencing an issue with Gmail, Google Chat, Google Voice. Our engineering team continues to investigate the issue. We will provide an update by Tuesday, 2022-12-13 10:30 US/Pacific with current details.
Users may be facing unavailability for Gmail, Google Chat and Google Voice

articles.description: Our team identified that this issue has not impacted the Slack production app and current Android users should not be experiencing issues accessing their workspace. We will resolve this issue internally before our next Android app release.
articles.title: Incident: Some Android users may be experiencing issues when trying to access a workspace

articles.description: We've resolved the issue with access to Slack. Posts and workflows are back to full functionality. If you're still encountering any trouble, please reload Slack using Command + Shift + R (Mac) or Ctrl + Shift + R (Windows/Linux). Thank you for your patience while we worked on resolving this issue.
articles.title: Incident: Users may experience issues accessing or loading Slack, have trouble creating posts, and using Workflow Builder.

articles.description:
From January 6th at 8:42 AM PST to January 15th at 10:00 PM PST, some users were running into issues when completing their SSO configuration. In the SSO settings the "Test Configuration" button led to an error message page.

We identified a recent code change as the cause of the issue and a fix was launched to correct it.
articles.title: Incident: Some customers may be unable to complete SSO configuration

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From Monday December 12, 2022 at 10:27 AM PST to Monday December 19, 2022 at 1:30 PM PST, we began investigating reports of messages being marked as read when backgrounding the iOS app while in a conversation. As a result, the sidebar would not show unread messages next to the DM/Channel/Threads view. 


We have now made a change on our end that resolved the issue and released a fix on iOS app version 22.12.21. Users on the iOS app should now be able to receive messages without them being marked as read automatically.
articles.title: Incident: Messages on iOS are automatically marked as read
